2.SceneDescription: Central Perk, everyone is there but Chandler. Phoebe runs in, excitedly.

lines.Line: Hey you guys! Chandler's coming and he says he has, like, thisNEWLINEincredible news, so when he gets here, we could all act like, you know..
Never mind. But it was going to be really good
So, it's a typical day at work. I'm inputting my numbers, and big AlNEWLINEcalls me into his office and tells me he wants to make me processing supervisor
Why? This was supposed to be a temp job
Yeah, Chandler... you've been there for five years
Yeah, Chandler... you've been there for five years
If I took this promotion, it'd be like admitting that this is what INEWLINEactually do
So was it a lot more money
So was it a lot more money
It doesn't matter. I just don't want to be one of those guys that's inNEWLINEhis office until twelve o'clock at night worrying about the WENUS
Weekly Estimated Net Usage Systems. A processing term
So what're you going to do
So what're you going to do
I don't know. That's the thing. I don't know what I want to do. I justNEWLINEknow I'm not going to figure it out working there

(taps Phoebe on her shoulder) Um... hi there
(taps Phoebe on her shoulder) Um... hi there

Yeah... I just don't have that much cheffing experience. Unless it'sNEWLINEan all-toast restaurant
/strong> Well, what kind of food is he looking for
Well, he wants to do some ecclectic, so he's looking for someone whoNEWLINEcan, you know, create the entire menu
Yeah, I know! (turns to Chandler) So, what do you think
Thanks, Phoebe. But I just don't really see myself in a big white hat

6.SceneDescription: Monica and Rachel's, later. Rachel is waitressing, Monica is cooking. PhoebeNEWLINEwalks in with Steve (Crystal Duck winner Jon Lovitz).

lines.Line: Well hello! Welcome to Monica's. May I take your coat
Hello, Monica. (to Rachel) Hello, greeter girl
(overemphasizing) Mmmmmm! Everything smells so delicious! You know, INEWLINEcan't remember a time I smelt such a delicious combination of (Monica signals her to stop)NEWLINEof, OK, smells
Oh, thank you. Would you like a tour
Oh, thank you. Would you like a tour

lines.Character: (They leave on the tour and Rachel goes to follow them but Phoebe stops her and dragsNEWLINEher into the kitchen
lines.Line: They leave on the tour and Rachel goes to follow them but Phoebe stops her and dragsNEWLINEher into the kitchen.

OK, OK. I'm with you, Cheech. OK
(from the living room) Is it dry in here? (licks his lips
Let me, let me get you some wine

Yeah, I think we're ready for our first course. (Steve sits, MonicaNEWLINEbrings over a tray) OK, um, these are rot-shrimp ravioli, and celantro pondou sauce...NEWLINE(Steve starts to eat them one by one, quickly)... with just a touch of mints... and... (heNEWLINEfinishes)... ginger
Well, smack my ass and call me Judy! These are fantastic
Well, smack my ass and call me Judy! These are fantastic
I'm so glad you liked them
I'm so glad you liked them
Like 'em? I could eat a hundred of them
Like 'em? I could eat a hundred of them
Oh, well... um, that's all there are of these. But in about eight and aNEWLINEhalf minutes, we'll be serving some delicious onion tartlets

Excuse me? Can I help you with anything
Excuse me? Can I help you with anything
Excuse me? Can I help you with anything
You know, I don't know what I'm looking for.

lines.Character: (Rachel tries to get Monica's attention to tell her Steve is stoned. She pretends toNEWLINEdrag on a joint, and Monica thinks she's giving her the 'OK' signal. Then Rachel does itNEWLINEagain, inhaling deeply this time. Monica waves it off as though she doesn't believe it
lines.Line: Rachel tries to get Monica's attention to tell her Steve is stoned. She pretends toNEWLINEdrag on a joint, and Monica thinks she's giving her the 'OK' signal. Then Rachel does itNEWLINEagain, inhaling deeply this time. Monica waves it off as though she doesn't believe it.
(from kitchen) Ah, cool! Taco shells! (Rachel motions, YouNEWLINEsee!) You know, these are... they're like a little corn envelope
(joining him and taking the taco shells) You know that? You don't wantNEWLINEto spoil your appetite
(joining him and taking the taco shells) You know that? You don't wantNEWLINEto spoil your appetite
(looking in cabinets) Hey! Sugar-O's! (grabs the cereal box
You know, if you just wait another... six and a half minutes..
Macaroni and cheese! We gotta make this

Macaroni and cheese! We gotta make this
Oh, OK. (he drops the box on the floor) Oh, sorry. (When she bends downNEWLINEto pick it up he grabs a package of Gummi-bears from the cabinet.)
Why don't you just have a seat here? (he sits at the table, then triesNEWLINEto secretly eat the Gummi-bears. Monica spots him.) OK... give me the Gummi-bears

Well then you can't have any. (she grabs for the package, and it breaksNEWLINEopen. Gummi-bears fly everywhere, some into the punch bowl on the table.) Bear overboard!NEWLINEI think he's drowning. (he throws some Sugar-O's into the punch bowl) Hey fellows! Grab onNEWLINEa Sugar-O... save yourself! (Mimicking the bears) Help!  I'm drowning!  NEWLINEHelp
Why? It's just that I've waited seven years for an opportunity likeNEWLINEthis, and you can't even wait four and a half minutes for a stupid onion tartlet

7.SceneDescription: Chandler's office, he's on the phone, agitated.

lines.Line: (on phone) Yes, Fran. I know what time it is, but I'm looking at theNEWLINEWENUS and I'm not happy!... (Listens) Oh, really, really, really? Well, let me tell youNEWLINEsomething... you will care about it, because I care about it! You got it? Good! (slamsNEWLINEphone down, then leans back and realizes what just happened) Whooooaaaa...
